metadata.Description: Heating and cooling systems are technologies used to control the temperature and humidity of indoor spaces for comfort and energy efficiency.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Heating and cooling systems are technologies used to control the temperature and humidity of indoor spaces for comfort and energy efficiency.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
A concept that aims to ensure a fair and equitable transition to a sustainable energy system, taking into account social, economic, and environmental aspects.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.
Renewable energy certificates, also known as green certificates or tradable renewable certificates, are proof that a certain amount of electricity has been generated from renewable sources.

relations.Description: Heating and cooling implements Energy Efficiency Policy to promote energy-saving practices in buildings.

relations.Description: Heating and cooling contributes to climate change mitigation efforts through energy-efficient practices.

energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition employs a renewable energy workforce to support the transition to clean energy sources.

relations.Subject: just energy transition
relations.Description: The just energy transition collaborates with local communities to ensure a fair and inclusive transition to sustainable energy.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

Space heating is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It refers to the process of heating indoor spaces, such as residential or commercial buildings, to provide comfort and maintain a suitable temperature.
relations.Subject: space heating

relations.Description: Water heating is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It involves the process of heating water for various purposes, such as domestic use, industrial processes, or space heating through radiant heating systems.
relations.Subject: water heating

relations.Description: Air conditioning is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It refers to the process of controlling and regulating the temperature, humidity, and air quality of indoor spaces to provide comfort and improve the overall indoor environment.
relations.Subject: air conditioning

relations.Description: Refrigeration is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It involves the process of cooling and preserving perishable items, such as food, beverages, or medical supplies, to prevent spoilage or degradation.
relations.Subject: refrigeration

relations.Description: District heating is a sub-element of heating and cooling. It is a centralized system that provides heat to multiple buildings or areas through a network of insulated pipes, reducing individual energy consumption and promoting energy efficiency.
relations.Subject: district heating
